long_description: hvcs' mission is to promote prevention and wellness for all people, to encourage life-affirming decisions maximizing their quality of life, and to coordinate care for those living with complex health conditions. we envision the hudson valley as a place where all people, regardless of socio-economic status, live healthy lives and have access to the coordinated care they need to maintain their health. and by health, we mean all aspects: physical, mental, social and self-worth. a healthy hudson valley connects people living with serious, long-term illnesses with a wide variety of support systems to optimize their health and wellbeing, from great nutrition to access to services, freedom from the debilitating effects of substance abuse to eliminating the stigma that co-infects those with hiv/aids, mental health issues, and other diseases. the healthy hudson valley we picture is one in which underserved, disenfranchised communities cease to lag behind their more affluent neighbors on all health indices. hudson valley community services, inc. was known from 1986 until 2012 as mid-hudson valley aids task force, inc. d/b/a aids-related community services (arcs).
business_tags: human nutrition | consumer goods | physical fitness and wellness services | mental health | substance abuse | prevention & wellness | healthy living | community and service | health and wellbeing
generated_description: hudson valley community services, inc., formerly known as mid-hudsonian aids task force, inc. d/b/a aids-related community services (arcs), is a non-profit organization that aims to promote prevention and wellness for all people. their mission is to encourage life-affirming decisions to maximize the quality of life and coordinate care for those living with complex health conditions. they envision a healthy hudson valley where all individuals, regardless of socio-economic status, can live healthy lives and have access to coordinated care for physical, mental, social, and self-worth. they provide support systems for individuals with serious, long-term illnesses, including nutrition, access to services, substance abuse, hiv/aids, mental health issues, and other diseases. their vision is to see underserved and disenfranchised communities outperform their more affluent neighbors on all health indices.
